div.verse: The Greek word πρεσβύτερος (presbyter) literally means "elder." This letter is from the church leader to my dear friend Gaius, whom I genuinely love.
Dear friend, I pray that you're doing well in every way and that your physical health matches the good health of your soul.
I was overjoyed when some fellow believers came and told me how faithfully you're living according to the truth.
Nothing makes me happier than hearing that my spiritual children are living according to the truth.
Dear friend, you're showing true faithfulness whenever you help fellow believers, especially those you don't even know.
They've told the whole church here about your love. Please continue helping them on their journey in a way that honors God.
The Greek τοῦ ὀνόματος means "the name." They left to serve Christ without accepting any support from non-believers.
So we should support people like this, becoming partners with them in spreading the truth.
I wrote something to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves being in charge, won't accept our authority.

The Greek φλυαρέω means "to bring charges with evil words." So when I come, I'll call out what he's doing—spreading malicious rumors about us. Not satisfied with that, he refuses to welcome fellow believers himself and stops others who want to help them, even kicking them out of the church.
Dear friend, don't copy what's evil but copy what's good. People who do good show they belong to God, but people who do evil show they don't really know God.
Everyone speaks well of Demetrius—even the truth itself vouches for him. We also speak well of him, and you know our testimony is reliable.
I have much more to tell you, but I don't want to write it with pen and ink.
The Greek στόμα πρὸς στόμα literally means "mouth to mouth," an idiom for face-to-face conversation. I hope to see you soon so we can talk face to face.

The Greek εἰρήνη (peace) corresponds to Hebrew שָׁלוֹם (shalom), meaning complete well-being. May you have peace. Our friends here send their greetings. Please give our personal greetings to each of our friends there.
